member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.AbstractColumnSelection`1.BulkInsert
member.summary: A bulk insert will attempt to insert all records. If you have any unique constraints on columns, these must be respected. Notes: (1) Only the columns configured (via AddColumn) will be evaluated. (3) Use AddAllColumns to add all columns in table.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.AbstractColumnSelection`1.BulkInsertOrUpdate
member.summary: A bulk insert or update is also known as bulk upsert or merge. All matching rows from the source will be updated. Any unique rows not found in target but exist in source will be added. Notes: (1) BulkInsertOrUpdate requires at least one MatchTargetOn property to be configured. (2) Only the columns configured (via AddColumn) will be evaluated. (3) Use AddAllColumns to add all columns in table.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.AbstractColumnSelection`1.BulkUpdate
member.summary: A bulk update will attempt to update any matching records. Notes: (1) BulkUpdate requires at least one MatchTargetOn property to be configured. (2) Only the columns configured (via AddColumn) will be evaluated. (3) Use AddAllColumns to add all columns in table.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.AbstractColumnSelection`1.BulkDelete
member.summary: A bulk delete will delete records when matched. Consider using a DTO with only the needed information (e.g. PK) Notes: (1) BulkUpdate requires at least one MatchTargetOn property to be configured.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryCondition`1.Where(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Specify a condition.

member.summary: Specify an additional condition to match on.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryReady`1.Or(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Specify an additional condition to match on.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryReady`1.SetCollationOnColumn(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}},System.String)
member.summary: Set the collation explicitly for join conditions. Can be recalled multiple times for more than one column. Note that this should only be used if there is a collation conflict and you can't resolve it by other means.

member.summary: Commits a transaction to database. A valid setup must exist for the operation to be successful.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryReady`1.CommitAsync(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection)
member.summary: Commits a transaction to database asynchronously. A valid setup must exist for the operation to be successful.

member.name: T:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryTable`1
member.summary: Configurable options for table.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryTable`1.Delete
member.summary: All rows matching the condition(s) selected will be deleted. If you need to delete a collection of objects that can't be matched by a generic condition, use the BulkDelete method instead.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryTable`1.WithSchema(System.String)
member.summary: Explicitly set a schema. If a schema is not added, the system default schema name 'dbo' will used.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleDeleteQueryTable`1.WithSqlCommandTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Default is 600 seconds. See docs for more info.

member.summary: Set the name of table for operation to take place. Registering a table is Required.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleQueryAddColumn`1.AddColumn(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}})
member.summary: Add each column that you want to include in the query. Only include the columns that are relevant to the procedure for best performance.
member.param: Column name as represented in database

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleQueryAddColumn`1.Insert
member.summary: Inserts a single entity. This method uses a parameterized query.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleQueryAddColumn`1.Upsert
member.summary: Attempts to update the target entity (using the mandatory MatchTargetOn property). If the target entity doesn't exist, insert a new record. This method uses a parameterized query.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleQueryAddColumn`1.Update
member.summary: All rows matching the condition(s) selected will be updated. If you need to update a collection of objects that can't be matched by a generic condition, use the BulkUpdate method instead. This method uses a parameterized query.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleQueryAddColumn`1.CustomColumnMapping(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}},System.String)
member.summary: By default SqlBulkTools will attempt to match the model property names to SQL column names (case insensitive). If any of your model property names do not match the SQL table column(s) as defined in given table, then use this method to set up a custom mapping.
member.param: The object member that has a different name in SQL table.
The actual name of column as represented in SQL table.

member.summary: Exclude a property from the update statement. Useful for when you want to include CreatedDate or Guid for inserts only.

member.summary: Sets the identity column for the table.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.SimpleUpsertQueryReady`1.MatchTargetOn(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}})
member.summary: At least one MatchTargetOn is required for correct configuration. MatchTargetOn is the matching clause for evaluating each row in table. This is usally set to the unique identifier in the table (e.g. Id). Multiple MatchTargetOn members are allowed for matching composite relationships.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkCopy.BulkTable`1.WithSqlBulkCopyOptions(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions)
member.summary: Enum representing options for SqlBulkCopy. Unless explicitely set, the default option will be used. See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.data.sqlclient.sqlbulkcopyoptions(v=vs.110).aspx for a list of available options.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.DataTableOperations.SetupDataTable``1
member.summary: Entry point for setting up a DataTable. Each transaction requires a valid setup. A valid setup is one that ends with the last call being PrepareDataTable. Examples available at. https://github.com/gtaylor44/SqlBulkTools

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.DataTableOperations.BuildPreparedDataDable
member.summary: Builds a prepared DataTable. PrepareDataTable must be called during Setup for this operation to work. See documentation for examples. https://github.com/gtaylor44/SqlBulkTools

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.DataTableOperations.GetColumn``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}})
member.summary: Returns a column that has been added during SetupDataTable. Any custom column mappings adding during setup are applied. Notes: (1) Setup must use PrepareDataTable before calling this method. GetColumn will fail without a valid Setup. (2) Generics... Type must be of the same type used during setup. Refer to documentation for examples. https://github.com/gtaylor44/SqlBulkTools

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.DataTableAllColumnSelect`1.CustomColumnMapping(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}},System.String)
member.summary: If a column name in your model does not match the designated column name in the actual SQL table, you can add a custom column mapping.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.DataTableAllColumnSelect`1.RemoveColumn(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}})
member.summary: Removes a column that you want to be excluded from the data table.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.DataTableAllColumnSelect`1.PrepareDataTable
member.summary: Returns a data table to be used in a stored procedure.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkAddColumnList`1.CustomColumnMapping(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}},System.String)
member.summary: By default SqlBulkTools will attempt to match the model property names to SQL column names (case insensitive). If any of your model property names do not match the SQL table column(s) as defined in given table, then use this method to set up a custom mapping.
member.param: The object member that has a different name in SQL table.
The actual name of column as represented in SQL table.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkAddColumnList`1.AddTmpDisableNonClusteredIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Disables non-clustered index. You can select One to Many non-clustered indexes. This option should be considered on a case-by-case basis. Understand the consequences before using this option.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkAddColumnList`1.TmpDisableAllNonClusteredIndexes
member.summary: Disables all Non-Clustered indexes on the table before the transaction and rebuilds after the transaction. This option should be considered on a case-by-case basis. Understand the consequences before using this option.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkAddColumnList`1.RemoveColumn(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}})
member.summary: Removes a column that you want to be excluded.

member.summary: At least one MatchTargetOn is required for correct configuration. MatchTargetOn is the matching clause for evaluating each row in table. This is usally set to the unique identifier in the table (e.g. Id). Multiple MatchTargetOn members are allowed for matching composite relationships.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkDelete`1.DeleteWhen(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Only delete records when the target satisfies a speicific requirement. This is used in conjunction with MatchTargetOn. See help docs for examples.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkDelete`1.SetIdentityColumn(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}})
member.summary: Sets the identity column for the table. Required if an Identity column exists in table and one of the two following conditions is met: (1) MatchTargetOn list contains an identity column (2) AddAllColumns is used in setup.

member.summary: Sets the identity column for the table. Required if an Identity column exists in table and one of the two following conditions is met: (1) MatchTargetOn list contains an identity column (2) AddAllColumns is used in setup.

member.summary: Set the collation explicitly for join conditions. Can be recalled multiple times for more than one column. Note that this should only be used if there is a collation conflict and you can't resolve it by other means.

member.name: M:SqlBulkTools.BulkInsertOrUpdate`1.DeleteWhenNotMatched(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If a target record can't be matched to a source record, it's deleted. Notes: (1) This is false by default. (2) Use at your own risk.
